intro: Antirrhinum apterum, commonly known as the wingless snapdragon, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and parts of North Africa. It is characterized by its erect, branched stems and clusters of small, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of pink, red, and purple. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces seed pods that split open to release its seeds. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, often found in rocky or gravelly habitats. Antirrhinum apterum is a hardy perennial that is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens.
